means: （英国某些大学中的）学院院长

sentence.Network_en: Norrine Bailey Spencer is the associate provost and director of undergraduate admissions.

sentence.Network_en: The secretary in the Provost's office asked me what has happened.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 另设教务长(Provost) ，也是校级管理人员。校级管理人员之下设各职能办公室。
另设置副校长（Provost）协助校务。 但少数拥有多个校园的美国大学， 则会增设校监一职， 位阶高于个别校区的校长， 以方便校务 …
布什在清华大学... ... keep company with 和…结交，和…亲热 provost n. （牛津、剑桥等大学的某些学院的）院长 estrangement n. 疏 …
...副校长,vice chancellor,经过多层次的严格考核,评选,由分校校长任命,另设教务长,provost,也是校级管理人员,校级管理人员之下设各职能办公室,各院系设院长,系主任, 校长,副校长的具.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English profost 'head of a chapter, prior', reinforced in Middle English by Anglo-Norman French provost, from medieval Latin propositus, synonym of Latin praepositus 'head, chief' (see praepostor)

entry.def: In some university colleges in Britain, the provost is the head.

entry.tran: （美国某些大专院校的）教务长
entry.def: In some colleges and universities in the  United States, a provost is an official who deals with matters such as the teaching staff and the courses of study.
A provost is the chief magistrate of a Scottish administrative area.

entry.tran: （天主教或圣公会中的）主教座堂（或大圣堂）教士长
entry.def: In the Roman Catholic and Anglican Churches, a provost is the person who is in charge of the administration of a cathedral.

Sentence.sentence: Wisconsin has a "laserlike focus" on building up student skills in the first three months, according to vice provost (教务长) Damon Williams.
